physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang, It has a brown background, and features bunches of repeated purple and pink orchids. The background is decorated with filler motifs of tiny rosettes. The batik kain panjang is bordered by floral scrolling patterns.
sgcool_label_text: The ochre background of this kain panjang is characterisitic of the Kudus style, and recalls the soga brown Central Javanese batiks.  Bunches of purple and pink orchids are repeated on this batik, and are set against background filler motifs of tiny rosettes.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s.  This piece is signed “Batik Kesenian Liem Siok Hien Kudus”.
